main_definition: A bell is a hollow metal object, typically in the shape of a cup or cylinder with an open bottom, that produces a ringing sound when struck, often used to signal time, alerts, or events.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiom meaning something is attractive and pleasing
meanings_and_examples.example: The bell pepper has a vibrant color that makes it visually appealing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In sports, referring to the whistle or hand signal made by an official to indicate the end of a period or game
meanings_and_examples.example: The referee blew his bell at halftime during the basketball match.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A notification or warning sign that alerts people about something important, such as fire alarms or school bells
meanings_and_examples.example: The loud ringing of the church bell warned everyone to gather for Sunday service.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiom indicating a transition from one phase or activity to another
meanings_and_examples.example: After completing my exams, it was time to hang up my bell and move on to the next chapter of life.
